bugs.title: CVE-2021-30154 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on Special:NewFiles [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30154 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on Special:NewFiles [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30154 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on Special:NewFiles

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.12 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. On Special:NewFiles, all the mediastatistics-header-* messages are output in HTML unescaped, leading to XSS.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T278014

External References:

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T278014

Statement:

The mediawiki package was removed from OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) in version 4.3, therefore for OCP 4 has been marked as out of support scope.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1946690,1946691

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2021-30157 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on ChangesList pages [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30157 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on ChangesList pages [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30157 mediawiki: XSS due to unescaped messages used in HTML on ChangesList pages

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.12 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. On ChangesList special pages such as Special:RecentChanges and Special:Watchlist, some of the rcfilters-filter-* label messages are output in HTML unescaped, leading to XSS.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T278058

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1946693]

bugs.title: CVE-2021-30158 mediawiki: blocked users are unable to use Special:ResetTokens [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30158 mediawiki: blocked users are unable to use Special:ResetTokens [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30158 mediawiki: blocked users are unable to use Special:ResetTokens

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.12 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. Blocked users are unable to use Special:ResetTokens. This has security relevance because a blocked user might have accidentally shared a token, or might know that a token has been compromised, and yet is not able to block any potential future use of the token by an unauthorized party.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T277009

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1946699]

External References:

https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T277009

bugs.title: CVE-2021-30152 mediawiki: action=protect lets users with 'protect' permission protect to higher protection level [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30152 mediawiki: action=protect lets users with 'protect' permission protect to higher protection level [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30152 mediawiki: action=protect lets users with 'protect' permission protect to higher protection level

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.13 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. When using the MediaWiki API to "protect" a page, a user is currently able to protect to a higher level than they currently have permissions for.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T270713

bugs.title: CVE-2021-30159 mediawiki: users can bypass intended restrictions on deleting pages in certain "fast double move" situations [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30159 mediawiki: users can bypass intended restrictions on deleting pages in certain "fast double move" situations [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30159 mediawiki: users can bypass intended restrictions on deleting pages in certain "fast double move" situations

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.12 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. Users can bypass intended restrictions on deleting pages in certain "fast double move" situations. MovePage::isValidMoveTarget() uses FOR UPDATE, but it's only called if Title::getArticleID() returns non-zero with no special flags. Next, MovePage::moveToInternal() will delete the page if getArticleID(READ_LATEST) is non-zero. Therefore, if the page is missing in the replica DB, isValidMove() will return true, and then moveToInternal() will unconditionally delete the page if it can be found in the master.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T272386

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1948639]

Statement:

The mediawiki package was removed from OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) in version 4.3, therefore for OCP 4 has been marked as out of support scope.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as

bugs.title: CVE-2021-30156 mediawiki: Special:Contributions toolbar reveals existence of hidden users [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-30156 mediawiki: Special:Contributions toolbar reveals existence of hidden users [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-30156 mediawiki: Special:Contributions toolbar reveals existence of hidden users

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in MediaWiki before 1.31.12 and 1.32.x through 1.35.x before 1.35.2. Special:Contributions can leak that a "hidden" user exists.

Reference:
https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T276306

Created mediawiki tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1948644]

Statement:

The mediawiki package was removed from OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) in version 4.3, therefore for OCP 4 has been marked as out of support scope.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1948643,1948644

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
